comment.body:
> [anoni2p](#comment_6_121gfMsFtgVef47mbhgWE48M5zKk5Hf4Dc): Sorry, I expressed me wronght. Twister & ZN have a lot of JS, BUT twister works on my Firefox and ZN doesnt work with deactivated JS.

ZN heavily depends on JS for dynamic content. There does not seem to be a good solution when we need to keep the decentralization.

> [redacted](#comment_13_1QQggeZo72jptq7AvVQbrQKXZetKzF5kj): What we need is some kind of transpiler that can take JS written for the regular web and make it call the right ZeroNet APIs.

I don't think that practical. In clearnet JS only contacts the corresponding backend, where the querying of data is done. But in ZeroNet all that is done by JS. I can't imagine how would it be possible to write such a transpiler.
